problem: There are many two-digit multiples of 7, but only two of the multiples have digit sum of 10. The sum of these two multiples of 7 is what?
solution: The two-digit multiples of 7 are $$14, 21, \underline{28}, 35, 42, 49, 56, 63, 70, 77, 84, \underline{91}\text{, and } 98.$$Only 28 and 91 have digit sums of 10. The sum of 28 and 91 is $\boxed{119}.$
